instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U5701: What is U5701? this is the keyboard controller chip that takes the keyboard and trackpad input and turns it into a USB device signal for the machine to process. If replacing a keyboard doesn’t fix an issue with keys not typing, check all traces between keyboard connector and this IC. This chip has programming so it must be replaced from a similar, ideally identical board. .
definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.BUTTON_DISABLE: What is BUTTON_DISABLE? BUTTON_DISABLE disables the trackpad when SMC_LID is below 0.5v and the system believes the lid is closed. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
Immaculate condition, 
Never been opened and hardly used, said It hasn't been used for a couple of years because the battery died,, 

Installed new battery works perfectly except I cant move track pad cursor?

It clicks but wont move at all, I just tried 4 good flex cables and 4 good working trackpads, All do the the same thing, 

Reset Pram no change, 

Am I missing something daft here? evreything else works perfectly and the machine looks brand new inside and out!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
Something went wrong when you've taken out the old battery.
Maybe damaged trackpad connector (on the MLB).

Just in case, test without battery; let see if new battery can cause this issue.

Keyboard also not working?
Check if you can access boot menu at least.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
[ATTACH alt="TPCON.jpg"]60894[/ATTACH] [ATTACH]60895[/ATTACH] [ATTACH]60896[/ATTACH]
trackpad connector looks mint so does surrounding area, Im always careful as fuck and havent damaged a board by removing anything in a long time,

tried without Batt same result,
Keyboard works just fine,

Can access boot menu and trackpad click works but just cant move pointer,

I have just noticed that <CHIP>U5701</CHIP> is getting extremely hot! Like,, feels like a shorted component hot! other components feel hot in this area also?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
<CHIP>U5701</CHIP> should be good, if KB works.
<SIGNAL>PP18V5_Z2</SIGNAL> present?
If not, check <RESISTOR>R5805</RESISTOR>/6 and other components related with <CHIP>U5805</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP18V5_Z2</SIGNAL>  is NOT present.

Havent had time to check around   <CHIP>U5805</CHIP> yet as late for a meeting but Keyboard now not working and <CHIP>U5701</CHIP> gets  ridiculous hot as soon as I power the machine on, Worried to leave it on too long testing voltages in case it melts!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message: Then must change <CHIP>U5701</CHIP> first.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message: Not at the office atm, but I have a load of 2011 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boards, can I pull the chip off one of these to use?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message: Try and let us know if works.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
Giving this a go now, Just removed 2 chips from donor boards they look like the identical same chip,.

First board I melted the trackpad and keyboard connector even though I had protected them with foil tape, 

Second board I heated from underneath It came off without any visual damage but I am worried about over heating components on the other side near bios chip and cpu, 

Any advice on the best way of removing an replacing  the one from the good working board before I attempt it?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
Ignore the above,

I replaced <CHIP>U5701</CHIP> with one from a 2915. It wasnt easy but I got it done!

And Success! No mor hot chip!

And machine boots

And I have a working Keyboard again, And trackpad click!

But no track pad movement again! Mouse pointer just sits in the top left corner of the screen and dosent move at all, Tried 2 known good flex cables and 3 different track-pads... Again all works keyboard track pad click etc just cant move the cursor?

threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PP18V5_Z2</SIGNAL> present?
Just booted this into login screen and I get 18.3v measuring it at <RESISTOR>R5806</RESISTOR>

Found those heaters on ALi,, thanks dude

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
"18.3v measuring it at <RESISTOR>R5806</RESISTOR>"
At pin 2?

Check <SIGNAL>BUTTON_DISABLE</SIGNAL> level.
Be sure to have continuity for all traces between <CHIP>U5701</CHIP> and J5800.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>BUTTON_DISABLE</SIGNAL> level =0  

All continuity  good except for 

pin 4 of J5800 to pin 12 of <CHIP>U5701</CHIP> has no continuity

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message: Fix that problem...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message: How? :ROFLMAO:

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message: Rebuild the trace, run a wire if needed...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
Ran a jumper between the 2, Fiddly as fuck getting a tack on the side of that chip!

BUt............

Boom trackpad working perfectly again!

Thank you again Inf! another problem solved!
